tweets.text:
100 opinions on Acting 
by a former actor 
(a thread)

photo: Glory of the World by Charles Mee, Brooklyn NY, 2016 https://t.co/2oBsdmeW2c https://t.co/MveK3OWIP9
1. when you see 'good acting', you are more than likely witnessing a interconnected web of flow states
2. when you see 'bad acting', you are seeing someone disconnected from their body who is not listening

3. acting requires empathy. any actor who convincingly portrays 'a monster' (say Anthony Hopkins in Silence of the Lambs) is connecting to the humanity of that character. an actor who tries to play 'evil' will probably suck.
4. good acting requires social intelligence (ie how status shows up in relationships). A good actor can track all the status games being played and where they fit in.
5. acting is a drug. sometimes being another person and getting applauded it for it feels better than real life.

Changing it to one like one opinion 
I shouldn't agree to do 100 of anything...
6. good acting is telling the truth under imaginary circumstances
7. acting is always grounded in a larger context of story. even if someone is doing a one man show they're still in a relational field
8. acting is confusing. I fell in love with a costar once and am honestly skeptical of any actor who says that they haven't
9. acting is not being afraid to look like a fool. if you're overly preoccupied with others' perception of you, you won't be good at acting
10. there's a paradox in acting: the best actors are generous, present listeners but the profession attracts narcissists
11. some of my greatest moments of euphoria have taken place on a stage playing pretend. more significant than bungee jumping and cliff diving
12. like most awesome things, acting is constrained by the market. most people won't ever see a genius no budget off Broadway play put on by a theatre company who have spent decades playing together
13. acting is both really easy and extremely difficult

14. there used to be such things as resident theatre companies. sort of like a guild of artisans. now when you walk into auditions you're asked how big your social media following is so they can use you to market for them

15. many people associate acting with 4 or 5 movie stars that come to mind. shout out to all the other actors and artists who bust their asses to create and play with no guarantee of money, recognition, or respect

More on acting!

16. A lot of acting training is releasing the tension your body has stored up from living in a traumatized culture
17. The most free and spontaneous actors I have witnessed are trained clowns.
18. There are all sorts of theatre rituals and superstitions. Such as NO WHISTLING ON OR OFF STAGE https://t.co/HWwxOeno5j
19. DONT SAY "MACBETH" https://t.co/liGyvVjqYl
20. BREAK A LEG! https://t.co/Eut0Hj0nSR
